questions.question: If we're living in a simulation, what programming language do you think it's written in?
And more practically, what programming languages, if you were to advise like students today, should they learn?
What are the limits you want to put on the thing so it doesn't get chaotic?
Why is it taking so long to do all of these obvious upgrades which are cryptographically low danger?
So what do you make of the community of Bitcoin or that particular event in human history?
And so it's an interesting question of how do you incentivize the centralized aggregation of information?
Is it possible to have items in the game that are not controlled by Blizzard?
So basically who are you and is your money real or not, or are you a drug dealer or something?
What do you hope Jack Dorsey comes to understand about the difference between proof of work and proof of stake?
And what if you have a proof of useful computation where maybe you can do Woxitat or something, who knows?
How do you launch rockets when, if you fail a few times, you're gonna go bankrupt?
Do you think this is an interesting case study about leadership is for the leader to maintain anonymity?
And then the question is, okay, well, how do you even architecture, how do you handle choice architecture in that?
Can you take me through the journey of like philosophically what was going on in your mind?
Do you have advice for young people today, aside from playing lots of video games?
Do you think, I know what it is for me, do you have something like that?
